title.bibl: Scandia, Mar. 26, 1927. The Norsemen's Singing Society

notesStmt.note: Transcribed from digital images contributed to the Internet Archive by the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

revisionDesc.change: Initial TEI transcription from PanGeo Partners, Inc.

div.bibl: Scandia, Mar. 26, 1927. THE NORSEMEN'S SINGING SOCIETY

body.p: The great annual Sangemarked [song festival] given recently by the Norsemen's Singing Society at Dania Hall, drew an overflow crowd, that jammed the great clubhouse at 1651 North Kedzie Avenue. This year, the affair was in the form of an old fashioned cabaret. The hall was decorated to represent the cabaret "Den Rode Lygte" [The Red Lantern.]
The affair lasted three days, Friday and Saturday evenings, and Sunday afternoon and evening.
1. March, Norsemen's Singing Society's Orchestra, "Jask Ass," Director.
3. First Appearance of the Singing Society "Kighosten" [Whooping Cough] from "Cold Dale". Dreyfus Axelius Snossle, Director.
6. The Sensational "Long Tom," Worlds Tallest Singer.
1. March, N. S. Symphony Orchestra, "Jask Ass", Director.
3. Worlds Smallest Singers: The Mouse, The Mosquito, The Gnat, and The Microbe.
5. Second Appearance of the Singing Society "Whooping Cough". D. A. Snossle, Director.
1. Coffee Concert, The Norsemen's Singing Society. Knut Hansen, director.
4. Lillian and Catherine Haraldson, Piano and Violin.
3. The Shortest Singers in the World.
4. Solo, Gloria Med Svandsen [Gloria with the "Swantz"].

6. The last appearance, in this world, of the Singing Society "Whooping
Cough".
7. Sailor's Song, by Vise Knut [Knut Hansen].
9. Last appearance in Chicago of "Long Tom", Worlds tallest singer.
